metadata.title: Wednesday, 25th September, 2013
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)whether the electrification of Milenge District by the Rural Electrification Authority is on schedule;
(b)if not, what the cause of the delay is; and
(c)when the project is expected to be completed.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)whether the Government has any plans to connect electricity from Chembe to Itemba and Lwela in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)whether the Government has any plans to electrify other areas in Senior Chief Milambo’s Chiefdom and, if so, what the plans are.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)what the total number of functioning boreholes in Rufunsa District is;
(b)whether the Government has any plans of drilling more boreholes in the District in order to alleviate water problems; and
(c)if so, when drilling works will commence.
(a)when the Government will undertake a cattle restocking exercise in Rufunsa District; and
(b)what the estimated cost of the restocking exercise is.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)when the implementation of the Badea Water Project in Kawambwa and Mansa Districts will resume; and
(b)why the project has stalled for many years.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)whether there are any plans to link the Great East Road in Chongwe area to Kabwe District via Chipembi under the Link Zambia 8000 project; and
(b)if so, when the project will commence.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health when Kanakantapa Rural Health Centre and Kasosolo Clinic in Chisamba Parliamentary Constituency, whose construction have been completed, will be opened to the public.

parts: (a)how the people of Kabwe Central Parliamentary Constituency benefited from the hosting of the United Nations World Tourism Organisation (UNWTO) General Assembly; and
(b)what measures have been taken to ensure accountability of the monetary gains realised by public institutions from the hosting of the UNWTO General Assembly.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)what minerals are mined at Nampundwe Mine;
(b)what the uses of the minerals are; and
(c)whether the Government has any intentions to facilitate the expansion of the Mine.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the road to the Nampundwe Mine will be upgraded to bituminous standard.
questions.question_text: ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address – Motion (24th September) - Resumption of Debate.
